src package¶

src.instance module¶

instance.py¶

Module that used to read inputFiles and store information of a problen instance.

class src.instance.Instance(pop_dir: str, travelA_dir: str, nVolunteers: int, volResDelay: float, volWalkingSpeed: float, nBases: int, ambuResDelay: float, ambuBusyProb: float, ambuDist: list, threshold: float, maxDispatchDistance: float, nSteps: int)¶

Bases: object

Read input files and store information of a problen instance.

Parameters

  • pop_dir (str) – Path of input population file for the region of interest.

  • travelA_dir (str) – Path of the file that stores ambulance travel time information.

  • nVolunteers (int) – Number of volunteers.

  • volResDelay (float) – Volunteer response time delay in seconds from patient collapse.

  • volWalkingSpeed (float) – Volunteer constance walking speed.

  • nBases (int) – Number of ambulance bases.

  • ambuResDelay (float) – Ambulance response time delay in seconds from patient collapse.

  • ambuBusyProb (float) – Probability that an ambulance will be busy at time of the call.

  • ambuDist (list) – Ambulance distribution over the set of bases.

  • threshold (float) – Response time target.

  • maxDispatchDistance (float) – Dispatch radius in kilometer within which volunteers will be alerted.

  • nSteps (int) – Number of steps in greedy algorithm.

nVolunteers¶

Number of volunteers.

Type

int

volResDelay¶

Volunteer response time delay in seconds from patient collapse.

Type

float

volWalkingSpeed¶

Volunteer constance walking speed.

Type

float

nBases¶

Number of ambulance bases.

Type

int

Ambulance response time delay in seconds from patient collapse.

Type

float

ambuBusyProb¶

Probability that an ambulance will be busy at time of the call.

Type

float

ambuDist¶

Ambulance distribution over the set of bases.

Type

list

threshold¶

Response time target.

Type

float

maxDispatchDistance¶

Dispatch radius in kilometer within which volunteers will be alerted.

Type

float

nSteps¶

Number of steps in greedy algorithm.

Type

int

Number of locations.

Type

int

List of area unit code for each region.

Type

Read information from population file.

Parameters

Read travel time information.

Parameters

src.optimization_a_la_evaluate module¶

optimization_a_la_evaluate.py¶

Module that used to compute ideal volunteer location distribution using greedy algorithm without considering profile.

AdditionalOnTimeArrivalInLocation(nu: float, loc: int, stepsize: float) → float¶

Compute additional late arrival probability when a small volunteer mass is added to the given location.

Parameters

  • nu (float) – Original probability that volunteers appear in given location.

  • loc (int) – Index of location.

  • stepsize (float) – Additional volunteer mass added.

Returns

Difference in late arrival probability.

Return type

float

  • loc (int) – Index of location.

src.optimization_profile_time module¶

optimization_profile_time.py¶

Module that used to compute ideal volunteer recruitment distribution when we consider profile with different time segments.

class src.optimization_profile_time.ProfileOptTime(inst: src.instance.Instance, numTimeSeg: int, alphaL: list, lambdaL: list, OHCAProbL: list, profileL: list)¶

Bases: object

Computes the optimal volunteer recruitment distribution with given profile under both coverage and survival probability objectives.

Parameters

  • inst (Instance) – An Instance object that contains information read from the Input files.

  • numTimeSeg (int) – Number of time segments we are considering.

  • alphaL (list) – A list of volunteer acceptance probability during different time segments.

  • lambdaL (list) – A list of incident distribution during different time segments.

  • OHCAProbL (list) – A list of probability that OHCA occurs during each time segments.

  • profileL (list) – List of profiles that indicates where volunteers stays during different time segments.

nVolunteers¶

Number of volunteers.

Type

int

volResDelay¶

Volunteer response time delay in seconds from patient collapse.

Type

float

walkingSpeed¶

Volunteer constance walking speed.

Type

float

nBases¶

Number of ambulance bases.

Type

int

ambuResDelay¶

Ambulance response time delay in seconds from patient collapse.

Type

float

busyProb¶

Probability that an ambulance will be busy at time of the call.

Type

float

ambus¶

Ambulance distribution over the set of bases.

Type

list

threshold¶

Response time target.

Type

float

maxDispatchDistance¶

Dispatch radius in kilometer within which volunteers will be alerted.

Type

float

nSteps¶

Number of steps in greedy algorithm.

Type

int

nLocations¶

Number of locations.

Type

int

population¶

List of population for each region.

Type

list

area¶

List of area for each region.

Type

list

travelTime_A¶

Travel time for ambulance from bases to each location.

Type

list

Type

A list of volunteer acceptance probability during different time segments.

Type

A list of incident distribution during different time segments.

Type

maxDispatchTime¶

Max dispatch radius in time by assuming constant walking speed for volunteers.

Type

int

A¶

List of tranpose of profiles.

Type

list

AdaptiveLineSearch(alpha, val, x, g, d, theta=0.2, gamma=0.7, verbose=False, method='d')¶

Adaptive line search algorithm that determines the step size for Frank-Wolfe algorithm.

Parameters

  • alpha (float) – Stepsize obtained from previous iteration.

  • val (float) – Current objective value.

  • x (numpy.array) – Current iterate.

  • g (numpy.array) – Gradient.

  • d (numpy.array) – Search direction.

  • theta (float, default=0.2) – Parameter for adaptive line search algorithm.

  • gamma (float, default=0.7) – Parameter for adaptive line search algorithm.

  • verbose (boolean, default=False) – A flag indicates whether we want to print information mainly for the purpose of debugging.

  • method ({'l', 'd', 'w', 'w2'}, default='d') – Indicate which objective function we are using. ‘l’ - late arrival probability, ‘d’ - DeMaio, ‘w’ - Waalewijn, ‘w2’ - Waalewijn with fixed EMS response.

Returns

alpha_k – An appropriate stepsize that satisfies the sufficient decrease condition.

Return type

float

DeMaioSurvivalProb(responseTimeInSeconds)¶

Calculate probibility of survival (deMaio et al. (2003)).

Parameters

responseTimeInSeconds (int) – Time from patient collapse to EMS arrival.

Returns

survival – Survival probability of OHCA patient.

Return type

float

Frankwolfe_LB(init_x, eps=0.001, tol=0.005, theta=0.2, gamma=0.7, verbose=False, method='d')¶

A modified version of Away-step Frank-Wolfe algorithm.

Parameters

  • init_x (numpy.array) – An initial value $x_0$.

  • eps (float, default=1e-3) – Stopping criteria for gradient.

  • tol (float, default=5e-3) – Stopping criteria when objective function gets close enought to the lower bound.

  • theta (float, default=0.2) – Parameter for adaptive line search algorithm.

  • gamma (float, default = 0.7) – Parameters for adaptive line search algorithm.

  • verbose (boolean, default=False) – A flag indicates whether we want to print information mainly for the purpose of debugging.

  • method ({'l', 'd', 'w', 'w2'}, default='d') – Indicate which objective function we are using. ‘l’ - late arrival probability, ‘d’ - DeMaio, ‘w’ - Waalewijn, ‘w2’ - Waalewijn with fixed EMS response.

Returns

  • x (numpy.array) – Optimal volunteer recruitment distribution.

  • current_iter (list) – A list of objective values obtained during each iteration of the algorithm.

  • lower_bound (list) – A list of lower bound on objective function that computed during each iteration of the algorithm.

Waalewijn_model1(tVOL_in_sec, tEMS_in_sec)¶

Calculate probibility of survival (Waalewijn et al. (2001)).

Parameters

  • tVOL_in_sec (int) – Time from patient collapse to Volunteer arrival.

  • tEMS_in_sec (int) – Time from patient collapse to EMS arrival.

Returns

survival – Survival probability of OHCA patient.

Return type

float
